value.text: One, uh, "issue" with understanding why methane pollution keeps rising is that government agencies in petrostates such as the United States take methane pollution inventories mainly by asking polluters how much they pollute, then just unquestioningly tallying their answers in national inventories

Excellent long read on methane here.

tl;dr: world leaders have pledged to reduce methane emissions 30% by 2030, and yet, methane emissions keep rising. Solutions are found in agriculture (esp livestock but also rice), energy, and waste sectors.
